result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarvis Dontay Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated 4/2/15 mailed to Milwaukee County of Clerks with check for $500.00 (bail money) to be applied to Milwaukee County Case 2014CF4539.
Per Judge Aprahamian bail money is to be transferred to Milwaukee County.

The Defendant has been charged in Milwaukee and Waukesha Counties for the same course of conduct and like charges.  The Defendant has been charged in Milwaukee County in Case 2014CF4539.  The charges arise out of the same course of conduct but happened in two different counties.   The Defendant will enter a plea to the single count in the Milwaukee County Case (Count 94).  The Waukesha County case can be dismissed and read into the record at that time of the plea and sentencing in the Milwaukee County case.  The parties further agree that the Waukesha County Case 14CF1210 can be consolidated with Milwaukee County Case 14CF4539 for disposition as stated herein.  Order signed by Judge Aprahamian on 3/5/15.  The foregoing stipulation is adopted as the disposition of the Court.
Stipulation and order filed by Attorney Steinle.

Defendant Demarvis Dontay Johnson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant quashed (not issued). This matter maybe consolidated with Milwaukee County matter. Defense requests another date in 30 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court.   Defendant Demarvis Dontay Johnson did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises his clients medical condition and requests another date in 30 days. Defense will provide a letter from the Doctor to the court. Defense addresses Milwaukee County cases.   Court grants request and orders a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Demarvis Dontay Johnson in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Demarvis Dontay Johnson in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. No possession of any illegal prescription medication.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. No contact with any of the codefendants or witnesses named in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Demarvis Dontay Johnson in court, in custody.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant will be retaining Attorney Michael Steinle.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
